result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R Colassaco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy R Colassaco is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy R Colassaco was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample if one has not already been taken or on file.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

Defendant shall continue to comply with Soberlink.  DOC shall determine when condition can be terminated.  

Court permits defendant to travel out of state for work.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Good Time.  Defendant may serve jail time in 30 day increments with the cooperation and coordination of the ICSD.
**EFFECTIVE 05-14-18**:  Court orders 800 hours of Community Service in lieu of any jail time previously imposed.  No further jail time remains, per Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy R Colassaco

records.addlTxt: Discharge

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy R Colassaco in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 12:13 p.m.  Jason Sedovic from TAD Program is also present.  Per Court, Sua Sponte Court's own motion.  New factor-TAD Program Community Service provision.  Court orders def to do 800 hours of community service in lieu of previous jail ordered.  No further jail obligation.  Probation remains unchanged.  Court addresses def and Mr. Sedovic.  Financial obligations also remain in place.  Adj.  12:18 p.m.  klr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Timothy R Colassaco in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 2:59 p.m.  Cites appearances.  Gives court background.  Atty Lucarelli acknowledges rct of Amended Information, waives reading.  Court grants DA motion to dismiss Count #2.  PLQ filed.  Court questions atty-def pleads guilty.  No coercion.  Def admits signing PLQ.  Freely signed.  Atty satisfied def freely pleads.  Court accepts plea dn finds def guilty of Count 1.  DA states recommendation.  Atty Lucarelli agrees with recommendation.  State does not have any objection to def working out of state.  Court questions re credit for time served.  Determines 35 days credit.  Court orders:  Sentence Withheld, 2 years probation, 12 months ICJ with Good Time and 35 days CTS.  Jail time is to be served during 2 years or probation and may be served in 30-day increments with the cooperation and coordination of the ICSD.  DOC has rules, court has no control but permits def to travel for work and 2 years to complete sentence.  Atty Lucarelli asks court to find amendment in best interest of public.  Court satisfied by actions of def no concern for threat to public.  DA makes motion to dismiss 16TR186, 192 and 193.  Court grants motion.  Per Court:  Soberlink and comply to continue.  DNA sample if one not done-court finds surcharge is inclusive in $3500 total.  Atty Lucarelli asks for results to go to DOC and she can determine how long to continue.  Court allows.  Def to meet with DOC tomorrow.  DA reaffirms wants Soberlink to continue.  Adj at 3:13 p.m.  klr
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment

Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli appeared by phone means for Defendant Timothy R Colassaco.  DA calls case at 11:29 a.m.  Gives court background.  To be scheduled in approx 30 days.  Bond continues as established.  Adj. 11:31 a.m.  klr

Defendant appeared via telephone, attorney Steven M. Lucarelli appeared via telephone and Frederick j. Schellgell appeared in person for the State of WI.  No bojection by State re phone appearances.  Info has been filed and defendant waives reading and stands mute/preserves all jurisdictional objections.  Court accepts, clerk to enter NG pleas and court preserves all jurisdictional objections.  PTC to be scheduled in approx 30 days.  Bond continues. klr

Arraignment on August 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy R Colassaco in court, attorney Steven Michael Lucareli appeared via phone (no objeection from DA).  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases 16TR193, 195, 186 and 16CF21.  Date is STC and PTC on TRs and prelim on 16CF21.  Per attorney Lucarellie, he has discussed with his client, the right to a prelim.  Def understands and wants to waive.   Court questions defendant re waiving prelim.  Def agrees.  Court grants waiver.  Parties ask for ARGN to be set in 30 days.  Court grants continuance.  Atty Lucarelli to contact JA to schedule.  klr
